intro: Salpingolobivia huascha, commonly known as the Huascha flower, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its large, showy flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces blooms in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
